list.title:
The finest
of nature’s
food
list.description: Over the last few generations, our lifestyles have changed radically. We now live at a faster pace and often seem to lack time for balanced, regular meals. For many, processed meals have replaced simple, nourishing wholefoods. They are convenient, but often fail to provide  the nutrients we require. Since it began, Rainforest Foods’ purpose has been to help people combine good nutrition with modern living. We have sourced a range of wholefoods with exceptional nutritional richness that can support modern lifestyles rather than forcing them to change.

list.title:
Man and
nature
list.description:
Our Belief: Rainforest Foods believes that man and nature are forever bound together in a symbiotic relationship.
Our Purpose: Rainforest Foods exists to help man and nature take care of each other.

list.title:
Shared
earth
list.description: Rainforest Foods has adopted a philosophy we call shared earth. We believe that we all share a responsibility to help protect the earth and to improve the lives of those who need a helping hand. Most of our farmers live in the developing world; by sourcing organically grown superfoods from them, we help sustain their livelihoods and allow them to continue farming in an environmentally sustainable manner.  We also support a number of social partners and help fund their development work.

list.title:
OUR
PARTNERS
list.description: We work with a small group of partners including certification organisations, cooperatives, producers and social partners. All of these partners play a part in helping us to provide our customers with the finest ethically sourced organic superfoods. All of our products are organically certified by the Soil Association and registered by the Vegan Society. Our social partners include our nature partner: Rainforest Concern, and our people partner: Warka Water.

list.title: Barley Grass
list.description: Barley grass is the young, leafy growth of barley and contains a  broad range of vitamins and minerals.. Our barley grass is grown on the fertile Canterbury plains in New Zealand.

list.title: Acai Berry
list.description: Acai berries are the small purple fruit produced by the acai palm, a tree found in the Amazon rainforest. It is one of the most antioxidant-rich foods on the planet.

list.title: Cacao
list.description: Cacao is the raw base of chocolate, but it is a remarkable food in its own right. It is one of the most antioxidant-rich foods available, boasting a range of amino acids that make it a valuable part of a healthy diet.

list.title: Chia
list.description: Chia seeds are believed to have been a staple food of the Aztecs and have been hailed as a highly valuable food for centuries. They are rich in Omega-3 and Omega-6 in what we now know to be an ideal ratio.

list.title: Spirulina
list.description: Spirulina is a blue-green algae produced by photosynthesis. It contains a wide range of nutrients and has been described as nature’s multivitamin. It is especially high in iron.

list.title: Maca
list.description: Maca is a Peruvian root that was prized throughout the Inca empire for its adaptogenic-like qualities that enable it to nourish and balance the body's delicate endocrine system, and to help it cope with stress.

list.title: Chlorella
list.description: Chlorella is a useful supplement to a vegetarian or vegan diet and offers much of the nutrition we require, including protein, carbohydrates and a range of vitamins and minerals. It is especially high in vitamin B12.

list.title: Wheatgrass
list.description: Wheatgrass is the leafy growth of the young wheat plant. It is packed with nutrients, including essential vitamins, minerals, enzymes, phytonutrients and all the essential amino acids.

title: NEW AGE
OF TECHNOLOGY
description: Chlorophyll is the basis of life on Earth.
It helps plants turn sunlight into food and colours nature green.
It is responsible for many of the health benefits of barley grass, which is rich in chlorophyll.

title: INNOVATION
SILVER USE
description: Our acai berries come from communities in the Amazonian Rainforest, such as those in Porvenir, where acai cultivation is community-owned,
organic, wild harvested and sustainable.

title: YOUR
HEALTH
YOUR CHOICE
description: In the wild, cacao trees are hidden beneath the taller
rainforest canopy as protection from direct sunlight and wind.

title: ANTIMICROBIAL
PROPERTIES
description: For every Rainforest Foods product sold
we fund the purchase of one square metre of cloud forest
in the Neblina Reserve, Ecuador.

title: WATER-RELATED
APPLICATIONS
description: The lesser flamingo's staple food is spirulina,
and it is the carotenoids in spirulina that give flamingos
their vibrant pink colour.

title: NATURE'S SECRET
IS PATIENCE
description: Chia was first consumed as food over 5000 years ago but it is only
in the last few years that this small seed has become a global hit due to its amazing nutritional profile.

title: THE EARTH
HAS MUSIC FOR
THOSE WHO LISTEN
description: Nature can have a transformative effect on our wellbeing.
The sounds and sights of nature can help reduce stress,
enhance mood and improve mental health.

title: NOT ALL THOSE
WHO WANDER
ARE LOST
description: The search for nature's best often takes us to the world's most remote
places such as The Andes Mountains, 4000m above sea level,
where maca is found.

title: WATER
SUSTAINS ALL
description: Rainforest Foods supports charities such as Warka Water
that are developing innovative solutions to provide clean,
accessible and sustainable water supplies in the developing world.

title: WHEN YOU SEEK
YOU LEAD
IN DISCOVERY
description: Did you know that 95% of the ocean
is still waiting to be explored.
One of its treasures is Chlorella.

title: THE COLOURS
OF NATURE SAY
SO MUCH
description: From deep blues, to earthy browns to thousands of shades
of green, nature fills us with the goodness of colour.
Wheatgrass is a vibrant example.
